resources.string: Spell Tap
Welcome to Spell Tap!\n[Tap the screen to continue.]
You\'ve travelled for days, but your journey has just begun. At last, you stand before the world\'s top magic academy: The School of Thought.\n[Tap the screen to continue.]
[Tap on the academy.]
[Tap the academy again to enter.]
So you want to be a wizard? And partake in duels of sorcery? Then listen carefully...
Before any spells, you must learn to wield your Knife. Physical violence may be the last resort, but many a wizard owes their life to combat training. I will first teach you to Stab.
Starting from the lower left of the screen, slide your finger up ( ↑ ).
That\'s certainly a Knife! Try stabbing on the right side.
Good! Gesturing on the left half of the screen gives a left-handed Stab, and the right half gives a right-handed Stab.
Try another left hand Stab.
You show promise. Wait for me at the training hall.
Jack awaits you at the training hall.
Stab this wooden dummy 3 times to destroy it.
Do the K (Knife) gesture in either hand.
Now tap the bottom of the screen.
Nice! Repeat to finish off the dummy.
Well done. But let\'s see how you handle hostile targets.
Very funny, though strictly speaking you did destroy the dummy. You\'re lucky I know the Raise Dead spell.
Very funny. You\'re lucky I know the Raise Dead spell. We\'ll move on, even though you lost to a wooden dummy.
Clearly you know how to target your spells, so we\'ll skip a lesson. Train more on the dummy, If you like. Then see me back at school for your first magic lesson.
Again, do the Knife gesture.
Next, direct your attack to a goblin. Drag your finger from the Stab icon to a goblin. [Tap to continue.]
Now tap the bottom of the screen.
Good! Kill the other goblin, then destroy the dummy.
You learn fast. Come see me at the school for your first magic lesson. Or stay awhile and smash a few more dummies.
You\'re lucky I know the Raise Dead spell. Let\'s try that again.
Palm is a simple but powerful magical gesture.
Drag your finger downwards ( ↓ ) in the lower part of the screen to make the Palm gesture (P).
Good. In a duel, you could cast Shield now. Try P on other side.
Great! Shield protects you from all physical attacks. Do one more P. Switch hands again.
Excellent! But beware! Gesturing P with both hands means you surrender!
Double P loses, unless your opponent dies.
Your first opponent awaits you at the Arena. See me once you\'ve won.
Cast Shield (P) to block stabs.
If you end up in trouble, surrender by gesturing P with both hands.
Good luck! See you after the duel!
The Arena is closed.
Well fought! Let\'s pick up the pace.
A Snap gesture (S) goes diagonally up and away from the center, like a Knife gesture that veers outwards (L: ↖ R: ↗ ).
Make Snap with both hands.
Tap the bottom of the screen to confirm.
Next, the Digit gesture (D) is the same except you go toward to center (L: ↗ R: ↖ ).
Make D with both hands.
Surprise! S then D casts Missile. Unlike Shield, most spells take several turns to cast.
At any time, press [MENU] to access your spellbook and review all you have learned so far.
Have fun! Come find me later.
That\'s not right. Let\'s start again.
Now, Missile is useful, but can be blocked by Shield.
I\'ll teach you Cause Light Wounds, which deals 2 damage even to shielded targets. Meet me at the Training Hall.
To make a Wave gesture (W), run your finger diagonally downwards and away from the center (L: ↙ R: ↘ ).
Gesture Wave with both hands.
Tap the bottom of the screen
Now make the Fingers gesture (F) on both hands: run a finger diagonally downwards and towards the center (L: ↘ R: ↙ ).
Perfect! Gesture Palm with both hands. Normally this loses, but since WFP is Cause Light Wounds, you\'ll do 4 points of damage and kill your opponent!
Well done! Notice a gesture can only complete 1 spell, explaining why no Shield was cast.
I\'ll see you back at school.
Almost. Try again.
DSF casts Confusion. The victim must gesture identically with both hands next turn.
Observe a confused opponent who gestures P must do so with both hands, and thus surrenders!
Remember, press [MENU] to review all you have learned. Now head to the Arena, where your next foe awaits.
Recall Shield blocks Stab and Missile.
To deal with Shield, try Cause Light Wounds (WFP). The Confusion spell (DSF) may also help. Good luck!
Impressive! You\'re ready for more spells.
DFW is Cure Light Wounds, which restores up to one point of health.
And SFW is Summon Goblin, which summons a goblin to fight for you.
You encountered two goblins before. Each has 1 point of health and attacks for 1 damage.
Best of luck in your next battle!
There\'s a showier way to cast spells than tapping the bottom of the screen.
After gesturing, tilt the screen up vertically. When the bottom line flashes, tilt the screen back to its original position.
There are two more Level 1 spells. See your spellbook.
WWP is Protection From Evil. It acts as a Shield that lasts for 4 turns, including the turn it is cast.
PSDF is Charm Person, which forces the opponent to make a gesture of your choice on one hand. It also cancels with Confusion.
Your next challenger is waiting for you at the Arena. See me afterwards.
Congratulations! You are now a Level 1 Wizard!
Pick fights with other wizards at the Tavern, and earn experience by casting spells in duels. Then gain levels and learn new spells.
No doubt you found yourself disadvantaged whenever you failed to select a gesture for one or both hands.
From now on, this game will help you by insisting you have a gesture in each hand.
Welcome to Level 2! Your Summon spells are now stronger.
Monsters can attack the turn they are summoned. Spells may also target monsters as they materialize.
Experiment with the summoning circles to see what I mean.
Oops! You\'ve uncovered a bug!
You win!
You lose...
You both die. It\'s a draw.
Your opponent surrenders. You win!
You surrender...
You both surrender.

Interrupt spell combo. Starting next turn, target wizard must start spells anew.

Target monster cannot attack next turn. Freeze target hand of wizard: F, S, W become C, D, P respectively. If already paralyzed, the same hand is paralyzed again, otherwise the caster chooses the hand. Cancels with other psychological spells.
Trolls can do 3 damage, and have 3 hit points.
No other spells can be cast this turn. Unsummon all monsters, who still attack this round, and remove all enchantments. Global effect: works even when aimed at nothing. Shields target if valid.
3 magical damage to target. Ignores Shield.
Heal up to 2 health points. Cures disease.
Target dies within 6 turns from disease. Can be cured with Remove Enchantment, Cure Heavy Wounds or Dispel Magic.
5 fire damage (ignores Shield). Protects target in an Ice Storm.
Spells cast at target are reflected back at caster.
Giants can do 4 damage, and have 4 hit points.
Target dies within 6 turns from poison. Can be cured with Remove Enchantment or Dispel Magic.
Target becomes immune to damage from Fireball, Fire Storm and Fire Elementals until enchantment is removed. Destroys Fire Elementals.
Target becomes immune to damage from Ice Storm and Ice Elementals until enchantment is removed. Destroys Ice Elementals.
Each being takes 5 fire damage unless protected by Resist Heat or Counter-spell. Cancels Ice Storm and Ice Elemental, merges with Fire Storm, absorbs Fire Elemental.
Each being takes 5 fire damage unless protected by Resist Heat or Counter-spell, or is hit by a Fireball. Cancels Ice Storm and Ice Elemental, merges with Fire Storm, absorbs Fire Elemental.
Target dies, even if protected by Counter-spell. Ignores Shield.
